H0.text: They result in population decline when physical adaptations occur through natural selection in changing environments.

H1.text: They are all observable in the fossil record, reflecting physical adaptations that arise through natural selection in changing environments to help animals survive.

H2.text: They occur slowly over long periods of time, meaning that physical adaptations which help animals survive by natural selection in changing environments develop gradually.

H3.text: They are more likely to be observed in plants, the physical adaptations that occur through natural selection in changing environments to help animals survive.

A4.text: Phyletic gradualism is a model of evolution which theorizes that most speciation is slow, uniform, and gradual.

A5.text: Darwin theorized that the evolutionary process must occur gradually, not in saltations, since saltations are not presently observed, and extreme deviations from the usual phenotypic variation would be more likely to be selected against.
